content.question:
NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION.

Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit.

Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point.

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> is a real number.

The graph of the function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the closed interval <math alttext="negative 3 is less than or equal to x, is less than or equal to 8"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> consists of six line segments and the point <math alttext="with coordinates 5 comma 2"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown in the figure above. The function <math alttext="g"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="g of x, equals, one tenth, times, open parenthesis, 4 times x cubed, plus, 3 times x squared, minus 10 x, minus 17, close parenthesis"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>17</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. It is known that <math alttext="the integral from, negative 3 to negative 1, of, g of x, d x, equals, negative 4.8"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4.8</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the integral from, negative 3 to 4, of, g of x, d x, equals, 11.2"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo>=</mo><mn>11.2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(a)   Find the value of <math alttext="the integral from, 4 to 8, of, f of x, d x"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>, or explain why the integral does not exist.

frqParts.text:
NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION.

Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit.

Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point.

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> is a real number.

The graph of the function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the closed interval <math alttext="negative 3 is less than or equal to x, is less than or equal to 8"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> consists of six line segments and the point <math alttext="with coordinates 5 comma 2"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown in the figure above. The function <math alttext="g"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="g of x, equals, one tenth, times, open parenthesis, 4 times x cubed, plus, 3 times x squared, minus 10 x, minus 17, close parenthesis"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>17</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. It is known that <math alttext="the integral from, negative 3 to negative 1, of, g of x, d x, equals, negative 4.8"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4.8</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the integral from, negative 3 to 4, of, g of x, d x, equals, 11.2"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo>=</mo><mn>11.2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(a)   Find the value of <math alttext="the integral from, 4 to 8, of, f of x, d x"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>, or explain why the integral does not exist.

(b)

(i) Find the value of <math alttext="the integral from, negative 1 to 4, of, g of x, d x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>. Show the work that leads to your answer.(ii) Find the value of <math alttext="the integral from, negative 1 to 4, of, open parenthesis, 2 times, g of x, minus, 4 times, f of x, close parenthesis, d x"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>. Show the work that leads to your answer.

(c)   Let <math alttext="h of x, equals, g of x, for x less than or equal to negative 1; h of x, equals, f of x, plus b, for x greater than negative 1"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mo>{</mo><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mtd><mtd><mrow><mtext>for</mtext><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi></mrow></mtd><mtd><mrow><mtext>for</mtext><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>. Find the value of <math alttext="b"><mstyle><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="the integral from, negative 3 to 4, of, h of, x, d x, equals, 14.2"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo>=</mo><mn>14.2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(d)   Find <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 1, of, the fraction with numerator f of x, and denominator g of x, plus 2, end fraction"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. Show the work that leads to your answer.

topic.text: 4.7: Using L'Hospital's Rule for Determining Limits of Indeterminate Forms

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
